intro: Thiollierea campanulata, commonly known as the bell-shaped lily, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late winter to early spring. It is characterized by its strap-like leaves and has a tuberous root system that helps it survive in dry conditions. Thiollierea campanulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable climates.
